intro: Erophila medioxima, commonly known as the narrowleaf erophila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in coastal areas. Erophila medioxima is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
